title: Photos: Something in the Way music fest at Roadrunner, Day 1
author: Boston.com Staff
bullets: Something in the Way music fest at Roadrunner features two dozen indie bands over two days.
Notable performances on Day 1 included The Hotelier, Her New Knife, and Teen Suicide.
Photographer Ben Stas captured images of the event for Boston.com's coverage.

title: Patriots fullback Jack Westover says his sister bet Super Bowl LX matchup in training camp
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Jack Westover's sister won $18,000 by betting on a Patriots-Seahawks Super Bowl LX matchup during training camp.
Westover discussed his sister's successful prediction in a radio interview, noting her excitement with a second baby on the way.
Jack Westover, originally from Washington, signed with the Patriots in 2025 after playing college football at the University of Washington.

title: Watch: Mike Vrabel and Drake Maye address crowd at Patriots’ send-off rally
author: Trevor Hass
bullets: Drake Maye and Mike Vrabel spoke at the Patriots' send-off rally in Foxborough on Sunday.
Maye, dealing with an illness and shoulder injury, received MVP chants as he addressed the crowd.
The Patriots will play the Seahawks in Super Bowl LX at Levi’s Stadium on February 8.

title: ‘SNL’ recap: Best moments from Alexander Skarsgård hosting ‘Saturday Night Live’
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Alexander Skarsgård hosted SNL's 1,000th episode on Jan. 31, with Cardi B as the musical guest.
The episode featured appearances by Stellan Skarsgård, Jack McBrayer, and a cold open cameo by Pete Davidson.
Despite the milestone, the 1,000th episode did not have special celebration elements and proceeded as a regular broadcast.

title: Seahawks head coach Mike Macdonald grew up in Scituate and dreamed of running the Red Sox
author: Trevor Hass
bullets: Mike Macdonald, Seahawks coach and Scituate native, faces his hometown Patriots in Super Bowl LX on Sunday.
Macdonald's childhood dream was to become the general manager of the Red Sox, reflecting his love for Boston sports.
Macdonald, 38, has led the Seahawks to a 24-10 record and a Super Bowl appearance since becoming head coach in 2024.

title: Watch: Patriots’ Super Bowl LX send-off rally
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Patriots' Super Bowl LX send-off rally held at Gillette Stadium with speeches from Robert Kraft and Mike Vrabel.
The event featured a performance by Dropkick Murphys and appearances from several former players before the team departs for California.
New England faces Seattle Seahawks in Super Bowl LX, with the Patriots as 4.5-point underdogs according to sportsbooks.

title: Carlton Davis gives his pitch for free agents to join Patriots this offseason
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Patriots CB Carlton Davis praises team culture and coach Mike Vrabel's player-focused approach to attract free agents.
New England Patriots have cap space and are a Super Bowl team, improving appeal to free agents.
Talented 2026 free agency class includes targets like George Pickens, Trey Hendrickson, and Jaelan Phillips.

title: Where does Milton Williams rank among Patriots’ 10 best free-agent signings ever?
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Milton Williams signed a four-year, $104 million contract with the Patriots, becoming the highest-paid player in team history.
Williams recorded 5.5 sacks and nine pressures in the postseason, contributing significantly to the Patriots' Super Bowl LX run.
Williams is ranked as the eighth best free-agent signing in Patriots history due to his standout first season performance.

title: 8 lesser discussed potential trade deadline candidates that could make sense for Celtics
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Celtics are unlikely to make major moves before the trade deadline, focusing on roster additions instead.
Boston is considering potential trades for centers like Nic Claxton, Daniel Gafford, and other role players.
Budget constraints and luxury tax considerations influence the Celtics' trade targets and feasibility.

title: Something in the Way Fest 2026: Live updates from Roadrunner
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: The Something in the Way Fest 2026 at Boston's Roadrunner features 24 indie and alt-rock bands over two days.
Headliner Explosions in the Sky delivered a 90-minute instrumental set to close the festival on January 31.
Proceeds from Momma's merchandise sales at the festival will aid the Immigrant Law Center of Minnesota.
